parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE. The post includes a CMF number: "CMF 11240002". This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral advertising in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. The image clearly shows several candidates from the PNL (National Liberal Party) for the Giurgiu County.  Their names, photos, and roles (deputat/senator) are prominently displayed. This directly refers to specific candidates participating in the elections, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The post is not a private message; it's public and aims for broad dissemination, satisfying the "addresses the wide population" criterion.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. The primary objective of the post is to promote the PNL candidates in Giurgiu. The visual presentation, including the party logo and the candidates' photos and roles, strongly suggests an intention to influence voters to support these specific candidates. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. The post lacks journalistic objectivity. It's not presenting news or analysis; it's purely promotional material for specific candidates. It does not adhere to journalistic standards of impartiality and factual reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The content is not a personal opinion; it's a coordinated campaign promoting specific candidates. The use of professional photography and the inclusion of CMF number further reinforces this.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1298743991259471</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post contains a CMF number, directly promotes multiple PNL candidates for the Giurgiu County elections, uses professional imagery, and is a paid Facebook advertisement targeting a wide audience. All these elements strongly indicate that the post is electoral propaganda. The post's sole purpose is to positively influence voters towards the listed PNL candidates.  There are no counterarguments to suggest otherwise.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Aneta MATEI</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Toma PETCU</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Maria Gabriela HORGA</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Alexandru ANDREI</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Alina MECLEA</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Pana Gabriel], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1298743991259471) cu conținut electoral, ce promovează candidații PNL Aneta MATEI, Toma PETCU, Maria Gabriela HORGA, Alexandru ANDREI și Alina MECLEA pentru alegerile din Giurgiu,  utilizând imagini profesionale și numărul CMF 11240002,  având ca efect electoral influențarea pozitivă a votului în favoarea candidaților menționați.  Postarea, fiind o reclamă plătită pe o platformă publică, se adresează unui public larg și depășește limitele activității jurnalistice obiective.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
